Great post by Ben Smith.  I love to fish too! http://t.co/NIJcYJYD
On the way to school today I tried to explain to my ten year old son why Switchblades are illegal and handguns are legal.  Anyone?
Leaving to hike the John Muir Trail (JMT).  Yosemite to Mt. Whitney. http://t.co/4F6h0BV  Hoping to be done by Aug 23rd.
Deepa Krishnans wedding ceremony.  Indian weddings are a party! http://t.co/QdbtrVH
Milan, Italy. Alas, all good things must come to an end. Heading home tomorrow. Here's a wrap up of the trip: http://t.co/OkrnsNy
Chamonix, France. Mt. Blanc is BIG (tallest in Alps). Bought these two bitchen old school Ice Axes for our ski cabin. http://t.co/1MJXShe
Gruyeres, Switzerland. World famous cheese & home/museum of artist HR Giger, creator of aliens in movie Alien. Freaky! http://t.co/r7HdbHE
Zermatt, Switzerland. Climbed Shilthorn (near Murren). Note: Swiss trails go straight up! Saw the Matterhorn in the PM. http://t.co/a7EaMkP
Gimmelwald, Switzerland: Quintessential Swiss Alps. Cheese Fondue for dinner. Check out the cow bells! http://t.co/kUP0ozZ
Basel, Switzerland. Yesterday a long day driving thru 4 countries: SLO>A>D>CH. Met Bay Area friends. Gonna hike the Swiss Alps for 3 days.
Kranjska Gora, Slovenia. Enjoying the beautiful Julian Alps. Hiking, biking, ropes course, swimming in Lake Bled. http://t.co/oVsJjDK
Ljlubljana, Slovenia. Today we start this alpine adventure trip in the Julian Alps: http://bit.ly/o7FJCs
A Segway tour of historic Zabreb, Croatia yesterday. It's the latest dance craze in Europe! http://twitpic.com/61phuk
Why the USPS Should Be Privatized: http://shar.es/HE8xf
In Zagreb - capital city of Croatia. Hitting the museums today.  Off to Ljubljana, Slovenia this evening.
Today Plitvice Lakes National Park, Croatia. The coolest natl park you've never heard of. One of Europe's jewels. http://bit.ly/mP9ZZb
A car touring day thru Northern Bosnia. Steep green mountains, deep rivers and hilltop forts. I see why the Balkans were hard to conquer.
Sarajevo, Bosnia - home of the 84 Winter Olympics. History museum showed the appalling conditions during the 92-95 Serbian siege. War=hell.
Mostar, Bosnia-Herzegovina. Got tired of the beach. Time for some adventure travel. Bullet pocked buildings abound. Many mosques singing.
Another big sea kayaking day. Authentic Croatian dinner at a remote farmhouse. One of the best meals I've ever eaten. Homemade everything.
Today: Sailing on a 44' Catamaran. Got a fascinating Balkan history lesson from one of our guides. Breakup of Yugoslavia was ugly...
Lopud Island, Croatia. Today a LONG kayak trip to Kolocep Island. House sitter sent a pic of our Labradoodle (Comet). Missing my pooch!
Lopud Island, Croatia:  Sea kayaked to Sipan Island. Rough water! Hiked up to a farm for a lunch of homemade ham, cheese and wine.
Dubrovnik, Croatia. Starting this week-long kayak tour today: http://bit.ly/q1L2wz
Hvar, Croatia. Last six days: eat, swim, read, eat, swim, read, shower, arrive in port, drinks, dinner, walk, wine+cigar, sleep. [Repeat].
In Korcula, Croatia - an old & beautiful island city. Hometown of Marco Polo. Swimming a mile every day in the turquoise Adriatic. Goodness.
Dubrovnik, Croatia.  Arrived in country on Saturday.  On a small boat cruise with 30 peeps - mostly Aussies and Kiwis. Croatia stunning.
Driving to Bari, Italy to catch an overnight ferry to Dubrovnik, Croatia.  We are going to take this trip: http://bit.ly/pgEKm4
Sicily Day11: A boat/hiking tour of the Aeolian Islands. Best was watching Stromboli spew fire & lava in the air after sunset. Really cool.
Sicily Day10: Drove across the North Coast today. Saw Segesta - the most perfectly preserved Greek temple in antiquity. Getting templed out.
Sicily Day 8/9: The lovely hilltown of Erice and its 360° view of azure seas & olive trees. In a B&B with many farm animals. Six likes!
Sicily Day7: Marsala (Marsa Allah-Port of Allah). Big Arab influence on Western Sicily. Staying in a B&B that used to be a monastery.
Sicily Day 6: Agrigento and the Valley Of The Temples. Amazing Greek ruins. Hotter than Hades, but worth the sweat. On to Marsala.
Sicily Day 5: Modica. Reminds me of Granada (Spain). Favorite Sicilian city so far. Famous for chocolate. Beach/sunset in the pm. Gr8 day.
Sicily Day4: Chillin on a southern beach near Pozzallo for 2 days. Very rustic. No English spoken. Making wild guesses when eating. Sun hot.
Sicily Day 3: Visited Syracuse, home of Archimedes, and saw some excellent ancient Greek ruins. In Noto - a beautiful Baroque town.
Sicily Day 2: Mt Edna fantastic. HUGE winds and steep treks. To ancient Greek city of Syracuse today. Happy July 4th from Sicily!
Sicily Day 1: Arrived by car ferry yesterday and staying in Nicolosi. Climbing Mt Etna today. Sicily more beautiful & verdant than expected.
In Paestum, just south of Salerno. Magnificent Greek temples. Body surfed very decent waves with Six as we watched the sun set. Sublime.
Rome Day 6: National Museum of Rome and Hadrian's Tomb. Roman history is like porn, but better. Heading South to Pompeii tomorrow.
Rome Day 5: Took Six to a waterslide park as a respite from the museums. What a party!  Yanks are complete prudes compared to Italians.
Rome Day 4: Vatican & St. Peter's. Impressive, but would preferred to have seen the marble in the Colliseum (et al) where it was originally.
Rome Day 3: Caracalla's Baths and hiking/biking The Appian Way. Who knew that being a history geek would be such sweaty work.
In Rome.  Today the Colliseum, Pallatine Hill and the Forum.  Damn the Romans were good!
Just celebrated my In-Law's 50th wedding anniversary (Tuscany).  What a treat to see two people more in love now than they were 50 yrs ago.
Today Florence: David, The Duomo and The Uffizi. The Medicis were the VCs of the Renaissance. Michelangelo (et al) were the entrepreneurs.
Happiness is watching your son catch a Tuscan Firefly.
Just back from the amazing Cinque Terre - my favorite day so far.  Breathtakingly beautiful - hiking thru terraced vineyards.  Molte bene!
Today the Tuscan hilltown of Volterra and its famous alabaster.  Took my son to the Museum of Torture.  Gory!
Lucca today, and its famous walls.  Stopped by Pisa on the way home and saw the tower leaning.
Yesterday Cremona and its world famous violin shops (like Stradivari).  Today we arrived in Tuscany for a week of exploration and wine.
A Venice day.  The Doge's Palace, Correr Museum, Murano (ground zero for glass making).  Met a fun Brazilian couple & drank Prosecco.
In Venice.  Charming, as always, but swarming with tourists. Rats in a maze.  Vaporettos (water buses) are the best way to travel.
Oh, fair Verona, how I love thee!  Visited Juliet's balcony yesterday.  On the lookout for Romeo today.  Venice tomorrow.
Yesterday: Lake Como - Varenna and the real Bellagio.  I see why George Clooney likes it so much.  Today Bergamo.
In Locarno, Switzerland overlooking Lake Maggiore, drinking a bottle of wine and smoking a cigar.
Spent the night in Oleggio.  Dinner in the town square and watched a killer disco band rock the place.  Heading to Lake Como today.
Landed in Milan for three months in Italy/Croatia/Slovenia - European vacation 2011 begins!
